para: RemoveBadTriangle is a applied by the &skel; modifier. It removes triangular &elems; with excessively acute or obtuse interior angles from a &skel;. When used as part of a , triangles will be removed only if they have an interior angle less than acute_angle or greater than obtuse_angle.
shows the effect of RemoveBadTriangle when it's acting on acute angles. shows its effect on triangles with obtuse angles.

caption.para: The results of applying RemoveBadTriangle to the highlighted triangular &elems; in the left images are shown in the right images. In the top pair, the target &elem; and its neighbor, also a triangle, are both removed. In the bottom pair, the neighbor is a quadrilateral (also highlighted) and is reduced to a triangle (highlighted on the right).

The results of applying RemoveBadTriangle to the highlighted excessively obtuse triangles in the left images are shown in the right images. The neighboring &elems; which are also modified are highlighted in both columns. In the top pair of images, the neighbor is a triangle and is split in two after merging with the target triangle. In the bottom two pairs, the neighbor is a quadrilateral, which is either bisected or trisected after merging with the target triangle.
